etymology.description: 米 (“rice”) + 斗 (“dipper”) – to measure; to gauge.
etymology.interpretation: Rice being measured with a dipper conveys the act of gauging quantity. From measuring and estimating quantities, the meanings extend to materials/ingredients that are measured out and to the verbal sense of anticipating or expecting a result.

examples.chinese: 我料他今天不会来(我料他今天不會來)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ liào tā jīntiān bù huì lái.
examples.english: I expect he won't come today.

examples.chinese: 做汤前先准备好各种料(做湯前先準備好各種料)。
examples.pinyin: Zuò tāng qián xiān zhǔnbèi hǎo gèzhǒng liào.
examples.english: Before making soup, prepare all the ingredients.

examples.chinese: 她往锅里下了些料(她往鍋裡下了些料)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wǎng guō lǐ xià le xiē liào.
examples.english: She added some ingredients to the pot.
